titleStmt.title: Peace, peace, and we shall be quiet. Or, Monarchie asserted, the Kings right vindicated, and the present government of the church proved to be one and the same with that in the primitive times. All which assertions are composed for the regulating of distracted minds, and satisfying of tender consciences, or misled in their opinions. / By J.T. Gent.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
